item.title: Lenovo issues global recall for Thinkpad batteries
item.description: Lenovo has expanded a battery recall that was first announced on March 27, 2014. This recall now includes all affected lithium-ion batteries globally. The batteries, as announced in late April 2015, were manufactured for ThinkPad notebook computers shipped between February 2010 and June 2012. Lenovo stated that they are offering free-of-charge replacement batteries for all recalled batteries in the interest of public safety. The batteries were sold with new notebook computers or as optional or replacement batteries for the following models:

item.title: Businesses have the opportunity to take part in the For a Golden Home charity campaign
item.description: Cromly.com, a design portal and social media platform, has launched “For a Golden Home.” This online charity campaign aims to improve the lives of needy elderly individuals in Singapore this Chinese New Year. The platform allows organizations to create their own fundraising projects in support of this shared goal. Source: Cromly.com. Participating companies can create a pledge project to raise funds. Eunice Olsen and Paul Foster are ambassadors for the “For a Golden Home” campaign.

item.title: IMDA collaborates with telecommunications companies and financial institutions to assist small and medium-sized enterprises
item.description: Seven partnerships between the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), telecommunications companies, and financial institutions aim to accelerate the adoption of digital technologies by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). These partnerships will focus on providing SMEs with access to pre-approved, secure, and interoperable solutions in cybersecurity and data analytics. Launched in 2017, the SMEs Go Digital program helps SMEs adopt appropriate digital technologies at each stage of their growth. SMEs are a significant part of Singapore’s economy, contributing to roughly 50% of its gross domestic product and employing two-thirds of its workforce.

item.title: SPRING Singapore reviews its accomplishments in 2016
item.description: Despite a slowing economy in 2016, SPRING Singapore, a government agency supporting business growth, reported that over 16,000 companies enhanced their capabilities. These companies participated in projects backed by the Capability Development Grant (CDG) and Innovation & Capability Voucher (ICV) programs. SPRING estimates these projects will generate S$7.8 billion and create approximately 21,400 skilled jobs upon completion, representing a 13% and 43% increase from 2015 respectively. A record-breaking 2,400 projects received CDG support, almost double the previous year and the highest in five years.

item.title: Government support for research and development in Singapore SMEs and startups has been increased
item.description: The Singapore government is increasing its support for research, development, and commercialization (R&D&C) activities undertaken by small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and startups. This support encompasses financial assistance through grants, participation in business incubator programs, and favorable tax structures, as highlighted by Lim Chuan Poh, Chairman of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR), during his guest speaker appearance at the Developer and Global Entrepreneur Day, part of IBM’s XCite event in Singapore.

item.title: StarHub now offers mobile phone aftersales care to customers who have SIM-only plans
item.description: StarHub has introduced SmartSupport Lite, a new mobile phone aftersales service designed to be incredibly user-friendly. This service is specifically for customers with SIM Only plans, allowing them to quickly address any unexpected issues with their phones. Source: StarHub SmartSupport Lite offers mobile phone aftersales care to SIM Only customers. Signing up is simple - customers can register their existing phones digitally using the My StarHub app without needing any paperwork or activation fees.

item.title: DBS has been honored with the NTUC Women's Development Secretariat SG50 Special Award
item.description: DBS Bank has been granted the NTUC Women’s Development Secretariat (WDS) SG50 Special Award as recognition for its committed flexible working program and employee support systems. These programs are designed to assist staff in improving their time management and balancing their work and personal responsibilities. Cheong Meng Foong, Managing Director of Group Human Resources – Reward, stated that DBS takes a comprehensive approach to create a workplace where employees feel empowered, connected, and valued.
